page.title: 08Llangunllo Religion
page.content: There is one place of worship,St. Cynllo's church (Church of Wales), from which the village takes it name, in the village centre:two Methodist chapels have long been closed.The church holds a service every sunday, and though it has only a small congregation, it is invariably packed for Harvest Festival and Christmas Carol sevices, and, infact, much of the villages social life continues to revolve around the church.The church shares a vicar, who lives in nearby Whitton, with five other parishes in the local area.The Baptist chapel is outside the survey, but is attended by many people in the village.In recent years both Church and Chapel members have been prepared to take part in each others festivals.There are also a number of Methodists and a few Roman ** Continued... **
